page.title: 12LOCAL GOVERNMENT:HAMBLEDON
page.content: Hambledon has a Parish Council which tries to deal with local issues that arise in the village.Some decisions must be referred to Winchester County Council.The villagers may take up queries with the Clerk to the Council.The Council meets regularly for discussions. The villagers are notified on notice boards in shops and the centre of the village.There are 7 members on the Parish Council duly elected for a year in office. The Parish Council have the means to help financially with local problems such as facilities for the disabled or repairs to the church roof.
